stimulusHtml: Which of the following statements explains a weakness in Rostow's stages of economic growth model?
choicesHtml: The model is based on the principle of initial advantage that highlights the importance of an early start in economic development for all countries in the world.
The model is based on successive stages that countries must pass through independently until they reach high mass consumption without taking into account that countries are interdependent.
The model is based on the permanent classification of countries into the core, semiperiphery, and periphery, and countries are unable to move up or down from one category to another.
The classification for a country pertains to the entire country with no condition for variation in the level of development within a country.
The model is based on the premise that development in one place requires underdevelopment in another place.
